edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class Media

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.Media

  • public class Media
extends java.lang.Object
    The MediaFactory provides a mechanism for registering all of our images, sounds, and fonts Strictly speaking, we can re-create fonts on the fly whenever we need to. Caching them here is an optimization.

      • getSound

        public static Sound getSound(java.lang.String soundName)
        Internal method to retrieve a sound by name
        Parameters:
        soundName - Name of the sound file to retrieve
        Returns:
        a Sound object that can be used for sound effects

      • getImage

        public static TextureRegion[] getImage(java.lang.String imgName)
        Internal method to retrieve an image by name. User code should not call this.
        Parameters:
        imgName - Name of the image file to retrieve
        Returns:
        a TextureRegion object that can be used to create Actors

      • registerImage

        public static void registerImage(java.lang.String imgName)
        Register an image file, so that it can be used later. Images should be .png files. Note that images with internal animations (i.e., gifs) do not work correctly. You should use cell-based animation instead.
        Parameters:
        imgName - the name of the image file (assumed to be in the "assets" folder). This should be of the form "image.png", and should be of type "png". "jpeg" images work too, but usually look bad in games

      • registerAnimatableImage

        public static void registerAnimatableImage(java.lang.String imgName,
                                           int columns,
                                           int rows)
        Register an animatable image file, so that it can be used later. The difference between regular images and animatable images is that animatable images should be thought of as having multiple columns and rows, which allow cell-based animation. Images should be .png files. Note that images with internal animations (i.e., gifs) do not work correctly. You should use cell-based animation instead.
        Parameters:
        imgName - the name of the image file (assumed to be in the "assets" folder). This should be of the form "image.png", and should be of type "png"
        columns - The number of columns that comprise this image file
        rows - The number of rows that comprise this image file

      • registerMusic

        public static void registerMusic(java.lang.String musicName,
                                 boolean loop)
        Register a music file, so that it can be used later. Music should be in .ogg format. You can use Audacity to convert music as needed. mp3 files should work too, but may have licensing restrictions in some countries.
        Parameters:
        musicName - the name of the music file (assumed to be in the "assets" folder). This should be of the form "song.ogg", and should be of type "ogg".
        loop - either true or false, to indicate whether the song should repeat when it reaches the end

      • registerSound

        public static void registerSound(java.lang.String soundName)
        Register a sound file, so that it can be used later. Sounds should be .ogg files. You can use Audacity to convert sounds as needed. mp3 files should work too
        Parameters:
        soundName - the name of the sound file (assumed to be in the "assets" folder). This should be of the form "sound.ogg", and should be of type "ogg".
